symptoms.name: Severe paroxysmal neuralgic pain
symptoms.pattern: Deep in the ear, may spread to ear canal, outer ear, mastoid or eye regions; sharp, shooting, or burning; lasting for hours; triggered by cold, noise, swallowing, or touch

symptoms.name: Facial paresis (weakness)
symptoms.pattern: May be associated with herpes zoster oticus

symptoms.name: Deafness
symptoms.pattern: May be associated with herpes zoster oticus

symptoms.name: Disorders of lacrimation, salivation, and/or taste
Vesicular rash
symptoms.pattern: Unilateral, on the ear and mucous membrane of the oropharynx or palate

physical_findings: Painful vesicular rash on the ear and mucous membrane of the oropharynx or palate (Ramsay Hunt Syndrome)

imaging_findings.MRI: May be undertaken if there are polycranial neurological symptoms

required: Pain paroxysms of intermittent occurrence, lasting for seconds or minutes, in the depth of the ear
Presence of a trigger area in the posterior wall of the auditory canal
supportive: VZV polymerase chain reaction assay (using ear exudate) positive for Ramsay Hunt Syndrome
